I have had the same problem when compiling with 64-bit Alpha (Red Hat
Linux=
 7.0).  I was able to compile the code using g++ but cannot link
the canter=
a libraries to code compiled using the compaq cxx compiler.
    During link=
ing, I get undefined references. 

I am also trying to compile cantera on 6=
4-bit Itanium (Red Hat
Enterprise Linux AS release 3 ) with no success thus=
 far.

Marc

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "vincenzomulone" <vmulone@...>=
 wrote:
>
> Hi everyone, 
> does anyone have any news on compiling cantera =
on 64-bit machines? 
> I'm trying to do that on a 64-bit Alpha one (Red Hat=
 Linux 7.0). 
>  
> First of all I switched off all the python/matlab stuff=
 and it seems 
> to build quite correctly all the directory lib, but when i=
t goes to 
> build the binary cti2ctml, it gives an ld segmentation fault. =

> (exactly the following error: "collect2: ld terminated with signal 
> 11=
 [Segmentation fault] /usr/bin/ld: bfd assertion fail 
> elf64-alpha.c:3006=
"). 
>  
> But the worst thing is that, more generally, I don't succeed in =

> creating any shared libraries with the even compiled libraries for 
> th=
e same error of the dynamic linker. 
>  
> Do you have any idea to fix this=
 problem? 
> Thank you all. Vincenzo.
>
